metadata.description: Sample codebook analyzing NUS top 10 ranking achievement using Entman's framing functions

1: NUS has broken into the top 10 in a global ranking of institutions for the first time
It emerged eighth in the latest Britain-based Quacquarelli Symonds (QS) World University Rankings 2024
It was previously 11th in the 2023 edition
It is the highest-ranked Asian university and the first from Asia to be placed among the top 10 in the table
This achievement was made possible by the excellent contributions and outstanding work of our talented faculty, staff and students
NUS came in seventh for employment outcomes and 15th for academic reputation
The latest QS ranking features updated methodology using three new metrics â€“ an institution's commitment to sustainability, employment outcomes, and international research network
showcases NUS' dedication to research excellence, innovation and sustainability
This is a testament to our capabilities and commitment to providing a world-class and interdisciplinary education
to nurture agile and resilient graduates with diverse skills and knowledge for an ever-changing world
who remain deeply committed to flying the flag of our distinguished quality of education and creating positive impact in the classroom and beyond
This unprecedented milestone marks a remarkable moment for Asian higher education
commitment to providing a world-class and interdisciplinary education to nurture agile and resilient graduates
dedication to research excellence, innovation and sustainability
creating positive impact in the classroom and beyond
amongst many other prestigious institutions worldwide

1.title: NUS enters top 10 in global university ranking for the first time
1.description: Coverage of NUS breaking into top 10 QS World University Rankings for the first time
